Lichen planus typically presents with pruritic, polygonal papules, and plaques. Dermatitis herpetiformis typically presents with intensely pruritic papules and vesicles on the extremities and trunk. Bullous pemphigoid typically presents with tense blisters, not flaccid blisters.
